content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Your computer workstation should be arranged so that you can use comfortable postures when working with the monitor, keyboard, mouse, documents, and other items. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Computer monitor \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you work on a computer, you should have your eyes tested about every two years, or more frequently if you are experiencing problems with your vision. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your screen is at the correct height and viewing distance, it will help prevent or reduce eyestrain and muscle tension in your neck, shoulders, and upper back. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Screen height \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The top line of text on your computer screen (not the top of the monitor) should be at eye level, as shown on page 6. Most of the screen will be slightly below eye level. If you don’t have an adjustable monitor support, you can adjust the monitor height by removing the CPU (central processing unit) or disk drive from beneath the monitor, or by placing other stackable materials underneath the monitor to bring the top line of text to eye level. An adjustable monitor support is handy if you share a workstation because it makes adjusting the height of the monitor quick and easy. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Viewing distance \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The distance between your eyes and the screen should be about arm’s length. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Prescription eyewear \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Eyeglasses or contact lenses prescribed for general use may not be adequate for computer work. Prescription lenses can be made to maximize vision and comfort when working at a computer, either as glasses specifically for computer use or as bifocal or multifocal glasses. To determine your visual needs for viewing the computer screen, your ophthalmologist or optometrist will need the following information: \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Measurements from your eyes to the computer screen, work documents, and keyboard. For a more accurate result, have someone else take these measurements.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The size of the screen. Measure the diagonal of the glass and add on approximately 2–3 cm (one inch). \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A description of your job tasks. Describe your daily routine at the computer and how much time you spend each day at different tasks. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A description of the programs used. Mention whether you use text or graphics programs, the screen background colours, and the type size. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Type of lighting. Describe the lighting you work under, such as natural light, fluorescent lighting, and lights under a cupboard or shelf. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you are wearing glasses that were not specifically corrected for computer use, there are still ways to improve your vision and comfort at the computer. For example, bifocals are made for regular reading distances. However, most people place their computer screens farther from their eyes than they would place a book or other printed materials. When you view the screen through bifocals, you are likely tilting your head back to look through the bottom of your lenses. This could result in eyestrain and awkward neck and upper back postures. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You could try lowering your screen so that you can hold your neck in a more comfortable posture. You can also tilt the screen upward slightly, but watch for glare on the screen. If you continue to be uncomfortable after lowering your screen, an appropriate prescription for viewing the computer may help. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You can also try your old reading glasses or bifocals before buying special glasses for computer work. Your old glasses may be fine for viewing a computer screen, even though you may not be able to thread a needle or read a book with them. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Eye lubrication affects your comfort when using a computer and is especially important if you wear contact lenses. You may not blink as often at the computer as people doing other reading tasks. A dry office environment and the air quality can increase eye discomfort from this staring effect. You can help relax your eyes by focusing on distant objects and by occasionally getting up from the computer. You should also try to blink more often and perhaps use eye drops recommended by your eye doctor. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Keyboard \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your keyboard is at the proper height, you will be able to keep your wrists straight while keyboarding. This posture is more comfortable and decreases your risk of injury.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"To obtain the correct keyboard height: \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Adjust your keyboard surface up or down so that your wrists are straight when your fingers are on the middle row of keys.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your keyboard surface doesn’t adjust this way, raise or lower your chair until you can hold your wrists straight, while touching the middle row of keys. Remember, your work surface should be just below your elbows, with your forearms parallel to the floor.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You can also make a slight adjustment to the keyboard angle and height by folding the small legs — found on the underside of most keyboards — in or out. In most cases, you will need to keep the legs folded in to keep the keyboard flat and prevent bending of your wrists. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Do you tend to drop your palms or wrists while typing? If so, you could develop sore wrists. A palm or wrist support can provide support during rest periods from keying. When keying, your palms should not be resting on the support. Keep 5 to 10 centimetres (two to four inches) of space in front of the keyboard to rest your hands or to place a palm or wrist support. Make sure you place the palm or wrist support under your palms, not your wrists. The support should be similar in thickness to your keyboard. It should be made of a soft, smooth material and be free of sharp new types of keyboards are now available, including split and angled keyboards and keyboards with alternative key arrangements. Some workers have found that these alternative keyboards help reduce signs and symptoms of injury. However, alternative keyboards shouldn’t be seen as a quick fix to workstation problems. There may be other improvements to your workstation that would be more effective than replacing your keyboard. Before a new keyboard is purchased, your employer should make sure the problems at your workstation have been properly identified and assessed. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The mouse and other pointing devices \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Like your keyboard, if your mouse or height, you will be able to keep your wrists straight, shoulders relaxed, and elbows by your side while using it. This posture is more comfortable and decreases your risk of injury. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Here are guidelines for using a mouse:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Keep your mouse at the same height and as close to your keyboard as practical. You could develop a sore shoulder from prolonged reaching if the mouse is far from the keyboard or at a different height. You may have to obtain a rest (extension to the keyboard surface) specially for your mouse as some computer furniture doesn’t have room to place the mouse in the preferred position. Make sure you have enough space to move the mouse freely.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Rest your arm on an armrest or other support to support the weight of the arm and reduce the risk of shoulder problems. A mouse pad or rest may also help relieve pressure on your wrist from your work surface. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Move your mouse so you can keep your wrist straight. Avoid bending your wrist back or to either side during mouse work. Use a full arm motion from the shoulder when guiding the mouse. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Don’t hold your mouse too tightly. Relax your hand over the mouse. Take your hand off the mouse when not using it.\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If you are experiencing discomfort in your hand or wrist, try “palming” the mouse. Your hand should rest comfortably on top of the mouse without sliding back or to the side when you relax your arm. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"size\":24205,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/80691193-0929-432b-9277-76693de100a4/Hazard8.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/80691193-0929-432b-9277-76693de100a4/Hazard8.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard8.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard8.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"80691193-0929-432b-9277-76693de100a4\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":241,\"height\":356},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"size\":19006,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/e0c1e59e-7522-41fb-96f4-2c48819cea58/Hazard9.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/e0c1e59e-7522-41fb-96f4-2c48819cea58/Hazard9.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard9.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard9.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"e0c1e59e-7522-41fb-96f4-2c48819cea58\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":244,\"height\":212},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Other pointing devices such as wands, hand-held scanners (digitizers), or tablets and trackballs should also be within a comfortable reach if they are used often or for long periods of time. (These devices are used by graphic artists, draftspersons, engineers, and others involved in specialized computer work such as computer-aided drawing.) Your wrists should be straight and your upper body relaxed when using these devices. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"To obtain the correct working height for a pointing device: \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Adjust the work surface up or down so that your wrists are straight when you are using it. \",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your work surface doesn’t adjust this way, raise or lower your chair until you can hold your wrists straight. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Remember, your work surface should be just below your elbows, with your forearms parallel to the floor. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Multi-user and multi-task workstations \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Workstations used by more than one person or for a variety of tasks should be height adjustable. If you work at a multi-user or multi-task workstation, you should be able to quickly adjust it to suit you and the task at hand. Adjustable workstation components, such as monitor stands, keyboard supports, and work surfaces, allow you to do this. An adjustable chair and footrest are key elements to a multi-user workstation. These two components will help each user obtain the correct working height. You should also receive training in how to adjust the equipment and how to determine the correct posture for different tasks. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Documents \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Poor placement of the documents you look at while keyboarding may lead to muscle discomfort or eyestrain. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your documents are flat on the work surface — or far to the left or right of your screen — you may have to hold your head in an awkward posture for long periods to read the document. Or you may have to repeatedly move your head up, down, or sideways between the document and screen. To reduce the need for these movements, place the document as close as possible to the screen, with the documents at the same height and viewing distance as the screen. (See the drawing below) \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"If your work is mostly data input, move the monitor to one side and place the document in front of you, at the same height and viewing distance as the monitor. (See the drawing below) If the document is too heavy or large for a standard document holder, you can improve the viewing angle and distance by using a binder or some other object on your desk to prop the document up at an angle. You can also purchase stands specially designed for large documents. \",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"size\":25930,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/f2f86661-8cd8-441e-a6f2-d255c521bf20/Hazard10.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/f2f86661-8cd8-441e-a6f2-d255c521bf20/Hazard10.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard10.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard10.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"f2f86661-8cd8-441e-a6f2-d255c521bf20\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":244,\"height\":343},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"image\",\"data\":{\"size\":66153,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/f5faae16-951f-4b3c-8105-91d9f0c7f1e0/Hazard11.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/f5faae16-951f-4b3c-8105-91d9f0c7f1e0/Hazard11.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard11.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard11.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"f5faae16-951f-4b3c-8105-91d9f0c7f1e0\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":497,\"height\":747.0000000000001},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{\"size\":25930,\"src\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/14471201-73a2-4165-a0b2-01c10385bc46/Hazard10.JPG?preview=true\",\"path\":\"https://onboarding.epam.com/app/cdn/14471201-73a2-4165-a0b2-01c10385bc46/Hazard10.JPG?preview=true\",\"fileName\":\"Hazard10.JPG\",\"name\":\"Hazard10.JPG\",\"mimeType\":{\"type\":\"image\",\"subtype\":\"jpeg\",\"parameters\":{},\"qualityValue\":1,\"wildcardType\":false,\"wildcardSubtype\":false,\"concrete\":true,\"charset\":null},\"type\":\"image\",\"id\":\"14471201-73a2-4165-a0b2-01c10385bc46\",\"imageSize\":{\"width\":244,\"height\":343},\"extension\":\"JPG\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{\"color\":\"#669900\"}}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"How you arrange your phone, reference books, pens, documents, and other work materials at your workstation can affect your comfort. If materials that you use often are too far away, repetitive reaching can add to neck, shoulder, and upper back discomfort. \\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"In your mind, divide your work area into the primary and secondary zones shown above. The primary zone is your usual work area and is within easy reach (up to 30 centimetres or 12 inches from you). Place items that you use frequently or for long periods in this area. Arrange them around you in a semicircle. The secondary work zone is the area of occasional use (30 to 50 centimetres or 12 to 20 inches from you). Place items in this area that you use occasionally or for short periods of time. Organizing your work materials and accessories into primary and secondary work zones improves efficiency, creates more working space, and reduces the distance and frequency of reaches.
